name: Hotel Rocamar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Cute little hotel. simple but clean. Located right on the beach, it was rocky so you couldnt swim, but there's nothing like the sound of waves crashing while you fall asleep. Isla is tiny anyways so its just a quick walk to a swimmable beach. I would recommend this hotel if you're on a budget and want a clean place to stay on Isla.
reviews.title: Cute little hotel, great for exploring Isla

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would love to write a positive review of Roca Mar, but just can't do it. Construction noises woke us up every morning at 7:30am and we had to cover our things just to try and keep all the dust out of our clothes, on the beds, all over the floor, etc. Dust was everywhere and we were without water one morning too. Not so clean, too, as we saw several roaches. We renamed it "Hotel Rocha Mar".
reviews.title: Dirty, dusty, noisy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: On a positive note, even though we'd made our reservations just two weeks prior to the hotel changing hands, the new owners honored our reservation and tried their best to help us with whatever we needed. They are very, very nice and once the construction is completed, I imagine the hotel will once again be a decent, inexpensive place to stay right on the water.
reviews.title: Change in ownership and dustly construction

likes.liked: — Jabes, the employee let go by the new owners

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I went here under the high recommendation of friends. I stayed but 3 nights and moved to another hotel. The hotel changed hands in April. Jabes, a wonderful man who gave me a lead on a second hotel, was let go after 10 years at the Roco-mar. He was so kind and helpful. The noise and dust for the construction was just too much. I moved to a smaller hotel for the next two weeks and was much happier.
reviews.title: You can't get much closer to the sea that this!

likes.disliked: — All rather scruffy and the fan only worked on the fastest setting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2003, traveled solo
reviews.text: We spent 3 nights here. A great location - the sea is right outside your room and you sure can hear those waves!
reviews.title: Great little hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: lovely family run hotel, would recomend and return in a heart beat. right in the middle of the old town, few steps from the church, near all the tapas bars, no brits in this area which is a bonus. also close to beach and a short walk to the shops.
reviews.title: friendly boutique hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Stayed here week at the end of May 2012, hotel very central close to bars and beaches. Clean, nice staff and good breakfast with selection of cereal, pastries, tea and coffee and juices. Although in the centre of town and near bars was never woken up by niose. Roof terrace ok veiws over rooftops and towards marina below. I would definately stay at this hotel again and recommend to others.
reviews.title: smart b&b

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: and would recommend this trendy, family-run hotel, to anybody wishing to stay in the centre of old town Benidorm.
reviews.title: Recently Refurbished....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are lovely, but lack personality - could do with some artwork on the walls, for example.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would have like wifi in the room as well as in the public areas.
reviews.title: A little beaut!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we stayed 5 nights from monday 15 may.lovely little hotel very clean breakfasts were really great fresh food cakes and bread foe a healthly start to a day.the whole family are such really wonderful people and work all with a smile...ant time or the next time we stay in old town it will be at the roca mar...so just book and see for yourselves it is truly a lovely little place xx
reviews.title: fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We and friends spent three very enoyable nights at this hotel in May. It is modern. clean and centrally located in the old town, The staff are freindly and attentive. It is family run and informal. Breakfast was plentiful with a variety of hot and cold dishes, It is close to bars and beaches. Free safety deposit and able to keep room as we had a late f[ight It represented excellent value for money and we would certainly return
reviews.title: Rocamar-vellous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just got back home from a 4 night stay at the Rocamar (already booked return for September and March). From time of arrival, the people at this family run hotel were very nice and always willing to help in any way possible. The rooms are large and spotlessly clean. Breakfast very nice, although continental....pleanty of variety.
reviews.title: Such a wonderful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Yes, it can get a little noisy over the weekend, but we were there during 'pink' weekend which was very busy and still with shutters down heard very little from outside.
reviews.title: Good location and great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Great hotel, that's all there is to say.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We stayed here for 4 nights from 1st-5th July , Hotel is prety much faultless. Firstly room was spotlessly clean and well presented with a brand new 32inch widescreen TV , though like us if you're english its pretty useless if your not bilingual as there is not one english speaking channel on the TV.
reviews.title: July 5th

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bathroom was a good size and also very clean and the shower is more of a wetroom , there is an excellent roof terrace with fantastic views of benidorm and both its beaches and harbour area and there is an outside shower when it gets to hot , also sunbeds and a free jacuzzi (Although this was out of action on our first 2days) there is also a mini gym , if walking up and down the hills in benidorm is not enough exercise for you.
reviews.title: television?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The only downside we do have with this hotel is that we paid an extra 80euros for what was advertised as a superior room with a large balcony and seating area , if you have stayed in old town benidorm before then you know this a rarity hence why we paid extra but on getting to our supposed 'superior' room this balcony was standing room only for one person and even then it was a squeeze... For this reason we won't be staying there again but if this is of no bother to you ie very small balconies then you will love this hotel and its friendly staff who incedentally are a family.
reviews.title: A nice hotel located in a quiet area of the old town.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012
reviews.text: Pretty much agree with all that has been written so far, BUT, how can you have a new 32" television on your wall that supports 10 radio channels and 44 yes thats 44 television channels without ONE english channel of any description,,,,, so any english visitors,,, beware.
reviews.title: Very clean hotel in the old part the city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just a slight critisism,as the rest of the hotel was lovely.Just to catch up on the news back home would have been welcomed.
reviews.title: Great Hotel But Not As Good As Fetiche!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Have stayed at the Rocamar three times this year and each visit has been perfect.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is a small hotel run by an absolutely charming and very friendly family.
reviews.title: Consistent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Situated in the Old Town it is close to many bars and restaurants and yet it is very quiet and peaceful.
reviews.title: Spanish Treasure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are lovely with excellent facilities, spotless, and the bedding and towels are changed daily.
reviews.title: Found a gem!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast is great, serving delicious home made bread and cakes and a good choice of preserves, cheese and ham, as well as cereals, yogurts and fruit.
reviews.title: Loved it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Let me begin by saying if you are looking for luxury you need to stay at Nablam or Avalon or something. If you want to really experience the island or are on a budget, I suggest Roca Mar or somewhere similar...If you would like any information about Isla Mujeres please contact me. I researched the place for months and then didn’t know much when I got there...I will next time.
reviews.title: Better Every Day
The perfect getaway
reviews.text: We got lost walking to Roca Mar from the ferry so upon arrival we were hot and uncomfortable. You do not need a cab or anyone to carry your luggage, but you do need to know where you are headed exactly. They gave us a room key and let us go up without paying or checking in at all, we just gave them the page they faxed to us as confirmation of reservation. The first room's ceiling fan didn't work (there is no ac, so I had to tell management). They gave us a new, and better room immediately. If you are going for the cheapest room like we were, I suggest 211 or 311 if available. They are corner rooms so the view is better because the balcony is more open and you can see the pool too. I think they are $55, but we got it for $50 since we had to change rooms. There are suites for more.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: There were two double beds in both rooms we saw, a fridge, an amazing view of the Caribbean (you cannot swim on this side of the island at all), big balcony, a private bath and ceiling fan. The breeze at night is wonderful, so no ac necessary. I do suggest shutting the curtains at night, the first morning I woke up with the sun just beaming on us--beautiful sunrises from your bed.
reviews.title: Loved it so much, I reserved again for next trip as soon as I got home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2006
reviews.text: Management was very nice, maid service very thorough.
reviews.title: good and bad
Roca Mar is Isla for us
reviews.text: The pool was a life saver. It was so hot when we were there and the beach provides some relief from that, but you have to get to the other side of the island (about 5 blocks to beach), so we would jump in and cool off then walk to the beach.

reviews.title: Wonderful Introduction to Isla
reviews.text: For convenience, and an overall great introduction to Isla, Roca Mar makes a great home base. The rooms are rather spartan, but very clean and offer great prices when you consider its central location and the fact that it's right on the water (Atlantic or Caribbean side). The fresh breezes meant that air conditioning wasn't needed. We travelled with people who had been to Isla at least twice before, and we understand very well why they keep returning to Roca Mar. Getting off the ferry, we easily walked to the hotel in about 7 minutes - right up Morelos Street from the dock. The hotel is on the edge of the central plaza, anchored with the municipal offices, church and a large grocery store (good bakery and deli selections!). In the evenings there are a few vendors selling their crafts and foods (try the "cheros"!!) in and around the trees and open areas of the plaza. The main shopping and restaurant area (excellent variety) is an easy five minute stroll from the hotel. The evenings are very pleasant, and you can have a wonderful evening wandering past the shops (we found the vendors friendly and polite), having a leisurely meal at one of the many restaurants (good variety), and then wandering back to the hotel. There's a small restaurant at the corner of the hotel (indoor and patio) overlooking the ocean, offering a good variety of breakfasts and lunches. It seemed to be one of the more popular spots, and kept poor Pedro very busy going from table to table. Roca Mar is about midway along the Seawall Walk - a wide paved walk that parallels the coast and is ideal for leisurely strolling and breathing in the fresh sea air, sitting and reading on the wall, with the ocean below, or having a healthy walk or run. From the hotel, it's about a 10 or 15 minute walk, either along the streets or the seawall walk to the Playa Norte area. The beach along this stretch is beautiful with shallow waters and a wonderful protected lagoon on the east side, which is ideal for children and for snorkelling around the few offshore rocks. Roca Mar was a perfect location for us; everything we needed was easily accessible by foot, and the staff was friendly and very helpful whenever we had any questions. For location and price, I don't think it can be beat!

reviews.title: A Rock in the Sea
reviews.text: The Roca Mar is an interesting place, a bit like a ship in the middle of the waves. You step into your room and you see huge waves crashing right outside your window. When I was there the wind howled and seethed through the shutters and the roar of the waves was not exactly soothing but it was dramatic. The rooms were attractive and very reasonably priced. The only thing that bothered me was the dampness that pervaded the rooms because of all the sea spray. The beds were a little hard and had few covers, although I could have asked for more. It was warm but often cloudy when we were there in January, so I could have used a little more coziness, but I'm sure coziness is not a quality often sought on the island. The balconies were nice and there were hooks for hammocks. There's nothing luxurious about the rooms--they are quite spare-- but they have everything you really need. No TV but there is a little refrigerator. No air conditioning but I think the wind off the sea would keep you pretty cool when it's very hot. Also there's a fan and you could sleep in a hammock on the balcony. The garden is particularly charming, with its palm trees and birds, comfortable places to sit, and hammocks where you can lie and look up at the palms and the fabulous frigate birds. There is a lot of nautical decoration all around the office, which is an open air pavilion in the middle of the garden, enhancing the ship-like atmosphere of the place. The terrace around the small pool overlooking the Caribbean is another pleasant place to hang out. Also the hotel is near the grocery store and the main plaza so you can get a taste of local life. The people who work there are intriquing characters. The place is kept spotlessly clean and there is coffee available and spring water from water coolers. There is a nice restaurant for breakfast in the same building and you are close to everthing. You can take a pleasant walk along the promenade to the North Beach. Swimming near the hotel is said to be very dangerous.My main complai the fault of the hotel. In fact, when it rained they gave us some funky black umbrellas to use.

description: An affordable, relaxing escape in Isla Mujeres. Hotel Rocamar in Quintana Roo, Mexico. Reserve our Quintana Roo hotel online and get instant confirmation.
